Topic.Title: HTML convertor problems with title, responsive layout and sp

Posts.EditableText:
Hi, brand new to all this but the Quest engine looks very promising.

Anyway, I made a "Hello world" game using Quest 5.4.1, then managed to convert it for web (I think) with [url=https://github.com/textadventures/quest/releases/tag/v0.1-alpha:i3ued0al]this alpha-build convertor[/url:i3ued0al]. (Thanks for providing both.)

I couldn't find any instructions for the convertor, so if I missed something, please point it out.

The game [i:i3ued0al]seemed[/i:i3ued0al] to compile (after some initial crashes due to spaces in file and maybe directory names), but the web game opens titled "Game (Mobile)", rather than using the name I gave it in quest.

I'm using a desktop, but the mobile version of the game is all that I can get to run?  It looks like the game should be responsive, leveraging bootstrap.   How do I get a desktop or responsive version of the converted game?

Thanks in Advance,
Jill

Posts.EditableText:
The converter is at an early stage of development so there is no documentation for it yet. You can change the title yourself by editing the <title> tag in the HTML generated.

You may need to do other manual HTML updates yourself too. The template is a bit rough at the moment as you can tell!
